Name: 21 inc
Description: Building a Bitcoin computer - natively running Bitcoin protocol

Name: Airlock
Description: Decentralised electronic security - keyless access protocol for smart property combining IoT with "Internet of Money" (bitcoin 2.0)
Notes: Won 3rd Place at the Toronto Bitcoin Expo's "In Crypto We Trust" Hackathon

Name: ALEXANDRIA
Description: An open-source standard to allow users to distribute digital content, uses Bitcoin (for payment) and Florincoin (for index) blockchains and IPFS (for content storage and distribution)

Name: Altcoins
Description: Various alternative currencies with bitcoin-like properties. Altcoins tend to either replicate the BitCoin hashing algorithm, implement Scrypt algorithm or have their own algorithms
Notes: Unclear if altcoins fall into the technology side or the application side.

Name: Augur
Description: Decentralised prediction markets

Name: Backfeed
Description: "If the blockchain can be regarded as the TCP/IP (communication layer of the internet), Backfeed is building a canonical protocol and platform (akin to the HTTP protocol and the web browser) to enable blockchain-based decentralized collaboration, as easily as one would deploy a website today"

Name: Balanc3
Description: "Smart contract powered triple entry accounting system"

Name: Bitcoin
Description: Digital currency. Uses crytopgraphy and peer-to-peer tech to facilitate currency exchange without a central ledger (i.e. a bank)

Name: BitCongress
Description: Decentralised voting platform - based on Bitcoin, Axiomity (http://www.bitcongress.org/proj-noajax.html) and Counterparty

Name: Bitmessage
Description: Open source decentralised, peer-to-peer messaging service

Name: Bitnation
Description: "Bitnation is a collaborative platform for do-it-yourself governance" - "Governance 2.0"

Name: bitproof.io
Description: SealX is contract notary service stored on blockchain and GeniusX is an IP certification system based on blockchain

Name: Bittorrent
Description: Communications protocol for peer-to-peer file sharing - distributed data storage

Name: Bitwalking
Description: Currency/platform which rewards users for walking - currency can be exchanged for goods
Notes: How do they fund the platform? Advertising? selling insights into peoples behaviour?

Name: Blockai
Description: Digital asset distribution service

Name: BlockApps Strato
Description: Develop private (and semi-private) blockchains to build industry-specific blockchain apps

Name: Blockchain
Description: Core architecture of distributed trustless transactions

Name: blockcypher
Description: Platform infrastructure for building blockchain-based apps

Name: Blocknet
Description: "The Internet of Blockchains" - decentralised application platform

Name: blocksign
Description: Document verification service

Name: Blockstack.io
Description: Blockchain-as-a-Service a hosted platform for financial institutions to develop applications on private blockchains

Name: blockstrap
Description: html5 framework for blockchain applications - designed to work on any blockchain

Name: BoardRoom
Description: A tool aimed at organising decision making processes - blockchain governance
Notes: Originally aimed at creating decentralised boardroom activities - pivoted to help organisations "integrate into the blockchain"

Name: Chain
Description: Platform to "enable institutions to design, deploy, and operate blockchain networks that can power any type of asset in any market."

Name: Chainalysis
Description: "Building the compliance layer for the future of value exchange" - Due diligence and risk analysis

Name: ChromaWay
Description: Platform (http://chromaway.com/platform/) for handling "coloured coins" i.e. tokens of value (Blockchain 2.0)

Name: coinprism
Description: Coloured coin wallet (i.e. tokens of value)

Name: CoinSpark
Description: Service for adding messages to bitcoin transactions (and therefore trade assets (2.0))

Name: Colony
Description: Tool to help organise distributed, demfrocratic company-like entities/organisations

Name: colu
Description: Platform with accessible front end for storing/logging/transfering digital assets using blockchain (primarily Bitcoin?)

Name: Counterparty
Description: "a platform for free and open financial tools on the Bitcoin network"

Name: Credits
Description: "Interoperable blockchain platform"
Notes: Working on Isle of Man register of digital currency companies (http://www.coindesk.com/isle-of-man-trials-first-government-run-blockchain-project/)

Name: D-CENT
Description: EU project - Decentralised Citizens ENgagement Technologies - aimed at citizen engagement and empowerment - developing "blockchain toolkit" through Freecoin.ch - a social digital currency

Name: DAOwars
Description: IN DEV: A game which involves programming AI to compete through smart ethereum contracts

Name: DApp Store
Description: A project to build a decentralised app store (i.e. a store for DApps)

Name: Digix
Description: Physical gold investment marketplace with "Proof of Asset" smart contract

Name: Dogecoin
Description: Altcoin

Name: Drogulus
Description: "a programmable peer-to-peer data store"

Name: Epigraph
Description: Putting title registries on blockchain
Notes: Is/was allegedly working on the Honduran Land Registry with Factom: https://uk.news.yahoo.com/honduras-build-land-title-registry-using-bitcoin-technology-162701917.html#RM3nR6s http://www.coindesk.com/debate-factom-land-title-honduras/

Name: ERiS
Description: "free software that allows anyone to build their own secure, low-cost, run-anywhere data infrastructure using blockchain and smart contract technology"

Name: Ether Camp
Description: Ethereum Hack event(s)

Name: Ethereum
Description: Alternative non-bitcoin blockchain for smart contracts (currently command line executable code)
Notes: Good section on Ethereum smart contracts (http://www.wired.com/2014/03/decentralized-applications-built-bitcoin-great-except-whos-responsible-outcomes/)

Name: EtherEx
Description: Open source, non-profit, next generation decentralized exchange

Name: Etherparty
Description: A platform for managing and executing smart contracts on Ethereum

Name: Fabriq
Description: "A shared ownership social network" - uses Ethereum contracts to host a name registry and token ledger - To build own networks
Notes: a spin-off project from a hackathon hosted by the MIT Blockchain Workshop conference series

Name: Factom
Description: Storing records/other information on a blockchain
Notes: Is/was allegedly working on the Honduran Land Registry with Epigraph: https://uk.news.yahoo.com/honduras-build-land-title-registry-using-bitcoin-technology-162701917.html#RM3nR6s http://www.coindesk.com/debate-factom-land-title-honduras/

Name: FarmShare
Description: Potential blockchain supported community farming initiative

Name: Filament
Description: Internet of things startup - building large scale wireless networks for devices secured via blockchain (just to pay?)

Name: Filecoin
Description: A "Cryptocurrency Operated File Storage Network" - stores files - earn coin by renting space - proof-of-retrivability as opposed to proof of computation
Notes: By protocol labs - same as IPFS

Name: Florincoin
Description: Alternative coin with transaction comments based on Bitcoin and Litecoin source code

Name: Freecoin
Description: A set of tools aimed at providing a social alternative currency on which to run democratic social organisations

Name: Gnosis
Description: Crowdsourced prediction market

Name: Guardtime Keyless Signature Infrastructure
Description: Security and blockchain - "scalable digital signature based authentication for electronic data, machines and humans"

Name: HitFin
Description: Ethereum based derivatives trading platform

Name: Horizon
Description: A platform/currency

Name: Inflekt
Description: Events management platform

Name: IPFS
Description: Open source project to create a new hypermedia distribution protocol, addressed by content and identities.
Notes: "combines a distributed hashtable, an incentivized block exchange, and a self-certifying namespace" - by protocol labs - same as filecoin

Name: LaZooz
Description: "Decentralised Transportation platform" - rideshare system/community - differs by "fair share" mechanism
Notes: Smart transportation is about maximising already-existing infrastructure and resource rather than adding new ones

Name: Litecoin
Description: Altcoin

Name: MaidSafe
Description: Distributed file storage - used by contributing disk space - "a fully decentralized platform on which application developers can build decentralized applications" - Uses Horizon and Blocknet
Notes: Sells itself on security - all open source and released patents etc

Name: Maker Dai
Description: "Cryptobond" marketplace

Name: Mayor's Chain
Description: George Galloway's London budget on a blockchain - idea to make budget transparent by issuing tokens in line with GBP budgets and making departments spend the tokens - those who have had them spent can exchange for ������s (+ solicit crowsourced budgetting)

Name: Multichain
Description: "Open platform for building blockchains"

Name: Namecoin
Description: Blockchain-based DNS - information registration and transfer system

Name: NASDAQ linq
Description: NASDAQ developed blockchain-based stock market

Name: Omni (Mastercoin)
Description: A "decentralized asset platform" - "Create, customize, trade and transact your own digital property, using Bitcoin as the rails"

Name: Onename
Description: Personal ID on a blockchain
Notes: Recently switched from Namecoin to Bitcoin: http://cointelegraph.com/news/115270/onename-drops-namecoin-switches-to-bitcoin

Name: Oraclize
Description: "A set of tools and APIs aiming to enhance the power of smart contracts" integrating Bitcoin and Ethereum - all about being "provably honest"

Name: Peercoin
Description: Altcoin - "The world's first Proof-of-Stake coin"

Name: Provenance
Description: Tracks supply chains using Ethereum.

Name: ripple
Description: A "Global Settlement Network" - handling transfers between banks without third party - aimed at cross-border/foreign exchange transactions

Name: Rubix
Description: Infrastructure to allow big business to develop blockchain based applications

Name: Sia
Description: Decentralised cloud storage

Name: Skuchain
Description: Supply chain stuff

Name: Slock.it
Description: Service for renting, selling and sharing things that can be locked - combining IoT with blockchain ("the infrastructure of the sharing economy")
Notes: opening locks with money - Example - a fully automated AirBnB apartment; also has Ethereum computer for controlling IoT devices (locks) connected to Ethereum

Name: Solarcoin
Description: "a digital currency incentivizing solar electricity" - given to solar energy producers then other buy/sell (miners also get solarcoin)

Name: Solid
Description: "a proposed set of conventions for building decentralized social applications on the Linked Data stack"

Name: Storj.io
Description: Decntralised cloud storage built on blockchain
Notes: (Blockchain-as-a-Service) View FAQ - mention combining various technologies when they can (http://storj.io/faq.html#faq-1-7)

Name: Tahoe-LAFS
Description: Distributed cloud storage - "Least-Authority File Store"

Name: thingchain
Description: Using "cryptic QR codes" to track supply chain provenance

Name: Tieron
Description: "Using blockchain for government surveys"

Name: TransActive Grid
Description: IN DEV: Project by Io3 energy and ConsenSys to create an Ethereum based transactive energy grid

Name: Twister
Description: Decentralized microblogging platform using Bitcoin protocol and Bittorrent

Name: Ujo music
Description: Shared infrastructure for the distribution of creative digital products (i.e. music) focused on generating greater transparency, fairness and profitability - "ownership information and use policies on the blockchain"
Notes: Small existing prototype using a song from Imogen Heap - http://www.digitalmusicnews.com/2015/10/05/im-imogen-heap-and-this-is-why-im-releasing-my-music-on-blockchain/

Name: WeiFund
Description: Crowdfunding and equity platform based on Ether currency - benefit appears to be smart contracts which inherently allow for different models of equity share/guarantee on return of funding - especially good for digital asset return

Name: Woodcoin
Description: Altcoin modelled on renewable resources i.e uses logarithmic money supply curve

Name: ��nigma
Description: "a decentralized cloud platform with guaranteed privacy"

Name: Genecoin
Description: "Make a Backup of Yourself Using Bitcoin" - Put DNA data on the Bitcoin blockchain

Name: Everledger
Description: Storing records of diamonds on a blockchain to prevent insurance fraud and diamond smuggling
Notes: Uses crystallography to hash physical objects
